nodes.name: getprecedents

params._account: The address to add as a bearer.
params._role: The role to add the bearer to.

params._step: The step id of the step to retrieve precedents for.

getprecedents(uint256,uint256).return: An array with the step ids of the precedent steps.

hasRole(address,uint256).return: Whether the account is a bearer of the role.

params._step: The step id of the step to verify.

isLastStep(uint256).return: Whether a step is the last of an product_id.

params._precedents: An array of the step ids for steps considered to be predecessors to this one. Often this would  just mean that the event refers to the same asset as the event  pointed to, but for other steps it could point to other different assets.
params._product_id: The product_id id that this step is for. This must be either the product_id of one of the steps in _precedents, or an id that has never been used before.

newStep(string,string,string,uint256,uin.return: The step id of the step created.

params._account: The address to remove as a bearer.
params._role: The role to remove the bearer from.

addBearer(address,uint256).notice: Add a bearer to a role

getprecedents(uint256,uint256).notice: A method to retrieve the precedents of a step.

hasRole(address,uint256).notice: Verify whether an address is a bearer of a role

isLastStep(uint256).notice: A method to verify whether a step is the last of an  product_id.

newStep(string,string,string,uint256,uin.notice: A method to create a new supply chain step. The  msg.sender is recorded as the creator of the step, which might possibly mean creator of the underlying asset as well.

removeBearer(address,uint256).notice: Remove a bearer from a role

userdoc.notice: Implements a basic compositional supply chain contract.
